docs.lead_paragraph: Jody Kearns doesn't like to spend time obsessing about her Parkinson's disease. The 56-year-old dietitian from Syracuse, New York, had to give up bicycling because the disorder affected her balance. But she still works, drives and tries to live a normal life.

headline.main: Software Turns Smartphones Into Tools for Medical Research
headline.print_headline: Software Turns Smartphones Into Tools for Medical Research

docs.lead_paragraph: Her belly bulging, Hilda Angarita hauls herself to five different drug stores in the sweltering Venezuelan city of Maracaibo until she finally finds post-cesarean patches.

headline.main: Mother of All Battles in Scarcity-Hit Venezuela: Having a Baby
headline.print_headline: Mother of All Battles in Scarcity-Hit Venezuela: Having a Baby

docs.lead_paragraph: California should set clear guidelines for legalizing marijuana to stop the pot trade being dominated by powerful interests similar to Big Tobacco, a report from a panel overseen by the state's lieutenant governor said on Wednesday.

headline.main: California Panel Proposes Guidelines for Legalizing Marijuana
headline.print_headline: California Panel Proposes Guidelines for Legalizing Marijuana

docs.snippet: California should set clear guidelines for legalizing marijuana to stop the pot trade being dominated by powerful interests similar to Big Tobacco, a report from a panel overseen by the state's lieutenant governor said on Wednesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Eli Lilly & Co. reported Wednesday that an experimental medication might slow mild Alzheimer's if people take it early enough, one of a handful of drugs in late-stage testing in the frustrating hunt for a better treatment.

headline.main: Eli Lilly: Experimental Alzheimer's Drug Shows Some Benefit
headline.print_headline: Eli Lilly: Experimental Alzheimer's Drug Shows Some Benefit

docs.snippet: Eli Lilly & Co. reported Wednesday that an experimental medication might slow mild Alzheimer's if people take it early enough, one of a handful of drugs in late-stage testing in the frustrating hunt for a better treatment.

docs.lead_paragraph: The 11 million Americans who receive Social Security disability face steep benefit cuts next year, the government said Wednesday, handing lawmakers a fiscal and political crisis in the middle of a presidential campaign.

headline.main: Report: Social Security Disability Fund to Run Dry Next Year
headline.print_headline: Report: Social Security Disability Fund to Run Dry Next Year

docs.snippet: The 11 million Americans who receive Social Security disability face steep benefit cuts next year, the government said Wednesday, handing lawmakers a fiscal and political crisis in the middle of a presidential campaign.
